text: Butelkowane 05/12/2016. Piwo po przelaniu mętne, nieprzejrzyste z dużą długoutrzymującą się pianą. W aromacie Bretty niezbyt agresywne, uderzają natomiast niezwykle intensywne, kwiatowe i owocowe nuty (owoce tropikalne, głównie ananas). Chmielenie na najwyższym poziomie. A mistrzostwem jest umiejętność sprawienia żeby te Bretty podbiły aromaty chmielowe, nadając im fajny owocowy charakter. Smak lekko goryczkowy na finiszu. Alkohol w ogóle niewyczuwalny - pije się jak sok, albo jakieś dobrze nachmielone, kremowe pale ale. Niezwykle odświeżające, jedwabiste, kremowe. Poziom wyżej od "Brettowych" piw z Wicked Weed. Biorąc pod uwagę prawie 4 m-ce od butelkowanie jest bardzo dobrze. W lodówce czeka jeszcze wersja BA Dorothy ;).
Hazy pale golden color. Frothy white, massive dry fragerent, melons and grapefruit hoppy nose. Very dry hoppy tons of melon and white grapefruit in the mouth. Modest bitter finish. Very nice.

Pours a pretty clear yellow golden color with a big long lasting white head. Lots of bubbly carbonation. Nose of sour lemon, brett funkyness, a bit of hay, I dont get much hops on the nose. Maybe a bit of spicy, herbal, floral. A bit sweet at first, then you get the hop bitterness that lingers and the finish is a dry. Medium body. Easily drinkable. Such a well balanced, unique brew,

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Bevuta a Birre Sotto lAlbero 2016. Oro acida, appena torbida, schiuma media bianca, molto persistente. Al naso base saison con luppolatura generosa, sentori di scorza di limone, lime e arancia, frutta tropicale, leggero bretta, pesca, stalla. In bocca è equilibratissima e fresca, dolciastra allattacco, con finale amaro lungo e persistente, secca e pulitissima. Corpo medio, carbonazione media. Freschissima e di grande spunto e pulizia, fantastica!
Served several times in a Hill Farmstead wine glass. Have enjoyed the progression of this one over time, though still not quite my favorite. Love the American hops, particularly in the nose.

750ml bottle bottled 2016-04-27. Pours pale yellow with big fluffy anf foamy white head. Nose has notes of hay with some fruity and horsey bretts. Lots of fruity and floral hoppy notes. Fruity bretts also. Very fresh and aromatic. Quite engaging. Taste is quite bretty on the arrival with bitter hops. Finish is quite bitter with notes of bretts. Light resinous notes with nice malt background. Quite fruity coming both from brett and hops. Palate very smooth, nice mellow carbonation, refreshing body. Very nice horsey brett aroma mixed with notes of hay backed by malts and wheat. Always amazing how all that complexity comes up together nearly perfectly. Light honey notes on the finish.

Draft at Be.Re Roma, Italy. 16.12.2016. Taste with ippopotamo36. Ciaone Alberto. Pour it hazy yellow color with big white head. Aroma citrus, lemon zest, and pinch of herbal kind of tea. Taste smooth, dry, lemony, hoppy feel, slightly tart at the end, perfect balanced, lightly sour, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish. Nice to try this in Roma.
Birra di ispirazione belga con bretta e dryhopping, fruttata, amara decisa, un po acida, corposa

On tap at Be.Re. in Rome-Italy with markoijelena. Cheers to daniele. Bright hay cloudy pour, frothy white cap. Nose: lemon, strange brett, very floral, quite charming. Mouth is a bit below expectations although nice, lime/lemon, brett, clean creamy.

12 oz draft Finns Manor in Denver, Colorado. The pour is a hazed yellow golden with a well formed ½ inch white head. The aroma is soft herbal lemon citrus, leafy earth, soft funk Brett, and floral. The taste starts citrus tart, and quickly moves to the herbal, floral, earth Brett. The palate is medium bodied with soft natural carbonation and a dry, tart, floral finish. Really nice.

Pours a light hazy yellow with white head. A sour fruit and yeast aroma. A sour fruit, slight tart taste to start with citrus, spices, and yeast. A lingering sour, spice, citrus and dry yeast aftertaste.
On tap at Monks, a couple weeks ago (was it really that long?). Super light bretty beer with lemon highlights. Restrained funk. I looked down and it was gone.
Bottle at WTWBA 2016. Bottle is 2016 vintage. Hazy yellow pour with a white head. Mild citrus, yeast, some funk. Solid.
Bottle at WTWBA. Light yellow pour. Grassy wheat and citrus aroma. Taste is too dry and bitter for me. Not bad.

Hazy rustic golden with a thick sticky white head. Rustic farmhouse nose of lemon rind and dust and grassy bretty funk and bright tree fruity wheat and Belgian golden grains. Bright and delightful flavor thats just a kiss bretty but also sweet and tree-fruity sweet and lightly tart, a touch lemon zesty, clean and semi dry bretty finishing. Really amazing.

Bouteille 750 ml. Couleur jaune or, mousse blanche, léger voile. Arôme de levure sauvage, céréale et houblon. En bouche, belle rondeur, levure légèrement poivrée, houblon frais, céréales, texture agréable. Excellente.

Draft pour. The beer is a hazy yellow with a white head of fluffy foam. The aroma has notes of dried grassy, lemon zest, earl gray tea. Mild acidity and funk. Dry bitterness and some floral notes. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy bright yellow color ale with a huge pure white foamy head with good retention and some great lacing. Aroma of funky Brett notes with some citrusy and tropical fruit notes with some Sauvignon notes also clearly noticeable. Taste is a great mix of floral Brett notes with some funky barnyard notes, some tropical fruit and citrusy dry hoppy notes are also noticeable with some white wine notes that are clearly apparent. Body is full with limited filtration and good carbonation. Definitely one of the best saison out there.
On tap at three penny Montpelier. Pours golden, mostly translucent, white head. Dull earthy mess, light tartness, light bitterness. Finish is slightly dry and has a light body.

Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is earthy, grass, brett, funk and floral. Taste is tart with some spicy undertones. Light bodied with a crisp dry finish. Mouthfeel is somewhat grainy, very nice.
Cloudy yellow, white head. Funky citrus, bright lemon. Some spice. Lightly bitter, lightly sour, pleasantly sweet. Chewy, light body, fairly effervescent. Longer finish. Great.

On tap at hill farmstead. Pours out a cloudy apricot color topped with a white head. Nose is citrus zest Brett grain and some light tartness. Taste is more of the nice citrus fruits Brett and a light grain sweetness.

Sampled from the bottle, thanks Levi! Pours a hazy pale yellow with a with white head that lasts through out the beer. Aroma has a combination of earthy citrus with a earthy grain backbone and a dry grassiness. Flavor has a combination of earthy citrus and grass with a dry Brett finish.

Pale light hay yellow colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, pine, resin, some lemon. Bit sweet flavour, pine, hops. Sweet malty finish, yeast and brett.(from 75cL bottle @ RBBSG IV, the Hot and Sweaty Edition, Gent 2015. Thanks for sharing, yourilevesque !)

Bottle into a wineglass showing cloudy dull bright yellow with a finger and a half of clean white foam. 

The nose shows light creamy orange like an orange julius - a mix of fresh sweet oranges and creamer. Upon warming up, the dairy note fades and lightly intense sharp orange zest notes show.

The palate is light bodied with a full carbonated/foamy mouthfeel. Flavors of lightly bitter orange zest with the light citric orange notes constantly in the background. Light orange rind bitterness on the finish. Balanced and a little subtle, orange zest could be a little less with a little more juice.
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2016 Tried on tap at Blind Tiger Ale House a few days ago. Good aroma, appearance, nice brett taste. Subtle sour notes. Great overall, as expected.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of fruit, funk, and grain. Taste is citrus, tropical, funk, grass, and wheat. Very good.

Dated 7.2.15 The nose has a little Brett, a little fruit and a decent chunk of cheesiness. Its a little bit like a mikkeller but that cheesiness is off putting. Fortunately its not too apparent in the mouth, smooth, dry and slick.
Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Cloudy yellow with medium white head. Clean and crisp aroma and taste with tart citrus, slight funk and a lot of grassy, piney hops. Dry and clean finish.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2017 On tap at brewery. Pours cloudy yellow with a medium foamy white head. Aroma is yeast funk, some citrus, wheat, and spice. Taste is tart, funky, floral, and citrusy with hints of pine and spice. Dry, bitter almost tea-like finish. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Fantastic, crisp mouthfeel.  The saison as funky pale ale.
The aroma is full of hops, flowers, citrus, wheat, barn, yeast, sweets and sugar. The color is light orange. The taste is full of hops, citrus, peaches and apricot. Really good beer!

Bottle thanks to Steve. Pours a somewhat hazy yellow color with a large foamy head. A big nose of dusty earthiness and citra hops. Lemons, toast, light funky brett that really is fruit and mixes well with the big citra hops. Very smooth. Light. A bit of perfume and spices in the finish. Very good.

From tap at Mikkeller Bar, Århus. Aroma is grassy hops, bretty funk, saison yeast, citrussy notes, some lemon, touch of apple, mild herbs. Flavour is a bit tartish and above moderate bitter with a very dry finish. Body is medium. Exquisite hoppy Saison, both crisp hoppy and funky.

The Well, Brooklyn tap: pours light hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is delicate saison, light spice, delicate fruitiness, and the like. Taste is dry and lightly bitter. Very delicate and a joy on your mouth. Mild and pleasant aftertaste.

Pours a golden yellow color with a white head. Brett, funk, yeast, floral, fruit and biscuit aroma. Brett, funk, peach, pear, apple, orange, floral and biscuit flavors. Medium body and lively carbonation. Fruit, Brett and funk finish. On draft at Mikkeller Bar Copenhagen.

Keg at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.  Cloudy golden, mid sized head. Citrusy nose with some elderflowers and marzipan. Dry and crisp with slender body. Some grain, elderflowers and buckwheat complimented by citrus and papaya. Balanced bitter finish. Elegant and harmonious.
Duft citrus lime appelsin frisk smag frisk appelsin lime lidt grøn lidt krydret

Draught. Creamy white excellent mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and heavy hoppy and heavy yeasty aroma. Heavy bitter nice acetic/brett flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.
Very nice saison with lots of Brett taste giving a spicy and yeasty taste with a super dry finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, citrus, pine, hops and malt. Nice fruity finish.
pour pale with a fine white head. very floral, light unribe banana aroma. taste light bitter, sour notes. dry, lively, and light bitter finish

Bottle. Moderate grain and straw for the malt, moderate to heavy grass and spruce for the hops, moderate musty farmhouse for yeast, with notes of green apple and white wine. Head is average sized, frothy white with some slippery lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is hazy straw. Flavor starts moderately acidic, then finishes moderately acidic and bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively carbonation and a dry finish. Great mix of fresh Saison aromas and suitable hops in this Hill Farmstead beer.

Aroma of lemon, orange, barnyard, hay, funk. 
Pours out a slightly hazy straw colour with a tight white head. 
Taste is very crisp with same notes as the aroma indicated. Nice balanced tartness. 
Medium body, a little creamy and easy drinking, average carbonation, nice fruity and subtle drying finish. 
Awesome and very balanced saison.

Bámulatos illata virágoskert hangulatát idézi, selyemcukros, szénás, mentás nyalábok szövődnek egybe a levegőben. Üde, ropogós zamatai teltek, aromákban gazdagok, fűszeresek, szalmaízű malátás, száraz lecsengésűek. Igazi minőség, amit képvisel, minden kortya mérnöki módon megtervezett. Kissé már túlságosan is steril, egyszerűen hibátlan a maga nemében.
Cloudy golden yellow pour with aroma of lemon, grass,and funk. Slightly sour flavor with lemon, grass, and some barnyard funk. Great beer!
Tap. Pours light hazy golden with a big white head. Aromas of brett, fresh hops, grass, citrus, lemon, green grapes and apples. Taste is bretty, funky, citrussy, rural, green grapes, bitter finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Fairly clear copper pour with a small head. Funky, some light grains, citrus, stone fruits, some grape fruit and a light bitterness.

Tap @ mikkeller Aarhus. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of funky Brett, citrus, slight vinegar, pear and white wine. The taste is sour and vinous with rural staple notes, green apples, oak and hay.

Tap @ mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of brett, light tart, citrus. Hazy yellow with white head, mostly lasting. Taste is moderate bitter, brett and light sweet to dry. Medium body, oily feel, bitter brett finish.
At the brewery. Pours a cloudy, golden color. Aroma is a bit funky and the taste is a bit funk, a bit sweet. I think this is a very good farmhouse ale.

From bottle, courtesy of Peter. Brett, funk, b.o., yeasty and estery. Wonderful nose on this. Pale cloudy straw (w/lees) with thin white head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Funky, Bretty, cheese, rubber, dry. Bitter finish. Funky yeasty dry after. Really nice saison, with a little peach.
Luckily found on tap in Nebraska. Tart, citrus saison with good dose of dry hop bite and grassy body. Super crisp and drinkable.

Bottle. Lovely golden yellow, cloudy, with a fine head. Grapefruit nose, a bit pissy, brett, lemon, wheat. Tart and funky flavor, pissy, bitter, great grapefruit and light to medium tropical fruit as well. Soft, silky body with nice, fine carbonation. Very much in character with their house flavors. Very drinkable and tasty.

Dorothy bottle shared by KyotoLefty. 

A cloudy gold with a grassy fruity dry hopped aroma and bready brett and hoppy flavor for a soft light drinking lovely stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2016 On tap at the brewery, pours a hazy dull gold with a cream colored head. The smell is slightly funky, spice, citrus and wheat. The taste is as it smells with tangy, spicy clove with a crisp, dry ending. Light+ in body with courser carbonation than Im used to fromHill Farmstead....still above average compared to most craft beer.

Tried again in December 2016 in a bottled in September 16. Pours a hazy golden wheat color. Well, screw the words and the rating will rise as the tap version was a 3.5.

Tap at brewery. pours slightly hazy yellow with lots of foamy head. Nose is fruity, funk. Flavours of mango,funky tart, lemons some grassy bitterness some pine. Taste med/light bitter light sweet light tart. Silky body with some lasting bitterness.

Bottle (75 cl), courtesy of _angst_. CLear intense golden, medium to large fluffy white head. Fruity aroma, citric, horsey and chlorophyllic brett. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness, quite tannic.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Dorothy 2016 ].Unclear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, herbs, tropical fruit, peach. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, tropical fruit, peach, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160512]
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 Cloudy yellow color. Thick white head. Nose is lemon with a b.o./sweaty note coming in behind it. Medium farmhouse tartness.

Pours hazy golden lemony with a white head. Aroma brings by wild yeast flavor with light balanced sweetness and light funk. Flavor brings sweet wild yeast really nicely balanced with a bite on the backend.

Hazy straw yellow with thick frothy white head... Aroma of citrus hops, wheat and earthy malts... Flavor is light and earthy, lots of grassy and citrusy hop notes, herbal and yeasty notes on palate... Very similar to noble King... Really nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy yellow with a thin, white head that recedes quickly, leaving a ring and generous lacing. Nose is citrus up front with a malty undertone and notes of spice. Taste is delicate and reminiscent of grapefruit pith. Tartness and a honey-like sweetness married amazingly well. Light and crisp mouthfeel. Excellent brew!

Draft @ Warpigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty funky aroma with weak hints of citrus. Fruity malty spicy yeasty funky earthy flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty funky finish with hints of citrus.

Poured from bottle purchased at brewery. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma is lemony with a herbal yeast and slight funk. Flavor is light wheat, lemon, tropical fruit, mango. and a dry peppery spiciness, some horse blanket. Finishes with dry citrus and funk. Fantastic!

On draft at Prohibition Pig. The pour is a foggy golden straw color with a thin ring of white head that leaves some spectacular lacing all the way down. The aroma is juicy and tart up front before the sweet malt and a light spice roll through. This is everything I want in a saison. The flavor is great. The tartness is first and foremost the star. There is a light malt and a hint of spice, but its amazingly balanced and lovely. The mouth feel is perfect. Its light and crisp, with a softer bright carbonation and a lingeringly spicy tart malt finish. God damn.

Sample at Prohibition Pig with koleminer20. Aroma is funky, dry, barnyard, banana, clove, slight tart and citrus. Appearance is beautiful, light straw golden, white head, hazy. Taste is tart, citrus, funk, barnyard, slight banana and clove. Man. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, tart citrus dry aftertaste. Overall, good lord this is wonderful.

On tap at Warpigs. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma is citrusy, brett, wheat, tropical fruits ans some sweet malts. Taste is similar, complex and pleasant with grain, wheat, semi sweet malt, tropical fruits and brett.

750mL bottled 7/2/15, shared with Nelson on 6/3/16.Big white head, very well-retained, tops a light golden body with good clarity.Perfumey brett mixing with mild tropical fruits and tons of wheat goodness; lots of cereal-graininess that matches the dry, but fruity brett notes. Good cleanliness, with strong minerality and finishing with moderate citrus characteristics. No alcohol, despite being 7%, no flaw.Very well-carbonated and wheat-driven body lends grain, chewiness and plenty of dryness. Theres light honey to be found, but its very dry, and given to a mild guava-pineapple character from the brett. Doesnt seem alcoholic or sweet, but still comes off a bit heftier than most of the other farmhouse ales from Hill. Lots of body from the malt and wheat, with tight carbonation intensifying this. Good, but I dont find any reason to drink this over the table version.

August 5, 2015. Bottle @Sommarprovning, thanks for sharing!Hazy pale yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, light funky with ripe pineapple, mango, orange zest, lemon juice, some grass, grain and barnyard. Taste is slight tart, citrusy, some funky notes, sweet ripe fruits and light bitter. Finish light to medium rounded grassy and slight piney bitterness, some sweet tropical fruit notes, slight citrusy tartness and some barnyard funk. Medium bodied, average carbonation. 
Very good!
On tap it is a golden amber color with a nice head. Aroma of malts, grass and some herbs. Taste has lemon, flowers and some herbs. Nice finish.

Drank from a 750 ml bottle (shared with LadySusan) at Vices Versa in Montreal on May 27, 2016. Light hazy gold, medium head. Sweet pine and lemongrass aroma, fragrant Brett. Dry floral taste, notes of sweet hay, bitter but refreshing. A quintessential farmhouse style from VT farm country!
[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of fruity hops, funk, earth, citrus peels. Dry bitterish flavor, funky, fruity hops. Quite light-bodied. Great and refreshing.

Keg. Hazy yellow with a small white head. Nose has flowers, light soap, pepper, hay. Flavour is mild and less expressive than the nose suggests. Lemon, light soapy, hay, flowers, dust. Medium body, light/medium sweet with light astringency in a dry and somewhat bitter finish.

Tap @ Warpigs as "2016". Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, grapefruit, pine and tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, grapes, grapefruit, pine, tropical fruit, little sweet, hops and medium bitter.

Draught at WarPigs Brewpub, Hill Farmstead Day. Fading white head leaving solid lacework behind. Hazy golden body. Mid-dry aroma of sappy wheaty fruits. Comfortable mixed taste profile of citrus, wheat and tropical fruits. Brett to a maching bitter ending. Well bodied. Nice and refreshing (shared with KimJohansen and Skinnyviking, Copenhagen 12.05.2016).

Dense cloudy dull tan with no head. Aroma has a nice orangey character with a hint of brett. Has a fairly soft, full body with a nice pale malt character, light fruitiness and some background brett. The brett is drying out the finish right now.

Draught at Warpigs. Low white and quickly disappearing head. Hazy yellow body. Dusty hoppy hay lemon grapefruit aroma. Mildly hopped and slightly spicy pepper lemon grapefruit brett flavor. Low carbonation. Long finish.
On tap at Warpigs, pre-CBC. Pale golden with no head. Smells like basil, farmhouse funk and brett. The taste follows the same notes, dry and fruity brett on top of some basil and tropical fruit.

Bottle @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours slightly hazy white head. Aorma of light malt, yeast, light sourness, hay, tart fruit, grapes, light citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is light sourness, malt, yeasty, hay, fruity, light spice, light pepper, citrus, grapefruit. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, dry and lasting bitter finish. 120516
On tap at Warpigs. Cloudy golden with a small white head. Juicy fruit aroma with tropical character. Sweet fruity flavour with pineapple and peach. Somewhat sharp bitter finish.

Pours hazy golden with almost no head. Aromas of citrus, funk, floral notes, lemongrass, gooseberry, elderberry. Taste is funky and a little bit sweet with a moderate malty backbone. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Pours hazy apricot with low white head 
Aromas of citrusy fruits, hay, funk, barnyard 
Taste has notes of funk, barnyard, hay, citrusy fruits, herbs
Tap @Warpigs. Cloudy light amber, small white head. Sour orange aroma, light funk. Flavour has lemon, orange some grapes. Decent

12.05.2016, tap @ Warpigs:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet grassy, wet leafs, grass, wet hops, flowers, dried fruits, moss, yeast, bark hay. Taste is slightly dry floral, weeds, leafs, yeast, bark, minerals, sap, moss, flowers, light malts. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh and watery mouthfeel. Fair enough.
Tap @ Warpigs, tap take over. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeasty and rather hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 120516
Golden amber.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet zezty orange fruit nose... Juicy pepper floral orange fruit.. Ligh dry bitter finish
Draught @ Fools Gold. Flowery, spicy (clove!). A bit dry in the end. Nice round mouthfeel. Citrusy, hoppy and tart.

Bottle from PhillyCraft. Thanks Vin! It pours a lightly hazed pale yellow color with a nice white head. The aroma is amazing with lemongrass, flowers, ocean breeze, fresh citrusy grapefruit, hints of vanilla, funk and pale malts. Almost perfect. The flavor is very light with dry pale maltiness, lightly peppery and phenolic yeast notes. Herbs, grapefruit and orange hops. Its highly carbonated, but has a silky mouthfeel. A little tannic citrus in the finish. A complete delight to drink. Oh myyyy! (George Takai voice)

On tap at black back pub. Pale hazy yellow gold with lasting head and lace. Tropical fruit and mild funk aroma. Tropical fruit pineapple grainy malt sweetness. Spicy peppery bitterness and mild Bretty funk. Dry finish. Medium light body. Soft carbo. Fucking excellent.

Draught @ As Is NYC. Cloudy bright golden yellow with large foamy off-white head, faint citrus peel aroma, medium carbonation, lightly bitter with permeating citrus peel flavor, somewhat thick body, long bitterish citrus peel finish. Very smooth and citrusy, well balanced.

Poured from a 09/2015. 
Aroma has a nice light acidity and citrus. Medium light hop aroma with some floral and herbal, woodsy notes. Light phenolic peppery notes. Faintly poopy. 
Pours a hazy, pale straw color with a large, frothy, white head that slowly recedes leaving a pillowy head that lingers. High amount of lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is fairly dry and not sweet with some light grain notes. Medium bitterness. Some light peppery phenolic notes. Somewhat floral with some herbal and woodsy notes. A bit of pineapple and citrus. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Fairly soft mouthfeel. Light astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice beer and I think it is better when fresh. The hops work well with the saison and the esters and phenolics are nicely balanced. Nice water quality with good yeast notes. Still not my favorite Hill Farmstead beer though.

Draught at Fools Gold, New York.
Pours hazy golden.
Bitter hoppy taste of lemonand grapes with a little funk.

Pours a hazy pale yellow color with a full white head. Aromas of hay, light minerals, slight mustiness. Really light on the taste. Slight tang, slight sweetness. awesome drinking saison. Just delicious.
Tap at ginger man. Light cloudy yellow white sudsy head. Nose is Belgian yeast and some lemon. Tastes of lemon, banana, bretty, wool blanket, herbal, some lime. Crisp and zippy palate.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2016 Draft at Tria Taproom. Hazy yellow gold pour with a large effervescent bright white head. Wonderful lacing. Creamy lemon goodness! Clementines. Lemon verbena. Lavender. Straw. Bee pollin. Just sour enough to give a balancing tart bite. Ridiculously smooth! Fantastic! UPDATE:  Had again on draft at Monks a week later and was not as impressed. More biiter. Less balanced. But I will keep the rating from my initial review.

Bottle... Pours cloudy and yellow with a small, wispy, white head. Great retention. The nose is tropical, citrusy and bright - lemon peels mostly - accompanied by a modest measure of graininess. Light to medium-bodied with buzzing carbonation. The flavor is citrusy, bitter and bright. Crisp, clean, lightly bitter finish. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!

Poured a hazy golden color with a healthy white head. Aroma was light brett, lemon, mineral, sweet tarts, and grain. Flavor was lemony upfront, but more tangy than tart, grainy brett finish. Crazy this is 7%, so easy to drink.

Had this at the 2/20/16 Pittsburgh RB Gathering @ Insurrection in Heidelberg. Big thanks to my fellow ratebeerians! Especially big thanks to Dan for this one! Pale yellow. Has some of that big dull farmy aroma. Has some wet wool blanket farmy attributes about the taste as well. Yes, quite nice. I really liked this. its pretty darn good! Was expecting something over the top considering its from HF. Do I detect a hint of tartness in there? Yes, comes across rather well defined and civilized. Cant be 7%, no way. Smooth and easy finish. Thanks Dan!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: This beer is actually just amazing, like a better version of the already incredible Prairie Brett C with wonderful tropical fruit notes and a nice nice musty funk.
Hazy yellow color with a thick white head. Aroma of wheat, lemon, grass, and Brett. Flavor is lightly tart. Very enjoyable!
Tap at Rattle and Hum West, New York. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, spices, some sweetness, Belgian yeast and malts. Very fresh.

On tap at the Backcountry Pizza 5th anniversary party. Pours a pale, hazy, yellow, with a thin, white head. The nose is lemon, leather, earth, and some cloves. Surprisingly dry, with a light bitterness. Light to medium body, very astringent and dry, sticky, with a long, bitter aftertaste. This is a solid, impressive brett saison.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2016 10 oz at Star Bar. This is a hazy golden with a tall white head. The Brett is immediately evident in the aroma and brings a balanced, cheesy funk. The hop aroma isnt pungent, but rather gives a very welcome citrus kick. The palate is dry and spritzy. I really like the use of Brett on this one. Its at a tasteful level with suggestions of rye bread, cheese, pepper, and wool. A subtle citrus bite accompanies a light, basic malt base.

[November 22, 2016]

10 oz at Star Bar. This is a cloudy yellow with a pervasive head. Nose is funky and peppery with hints at lemon and straw. What a great saison. The flavor is bready, funky, very peppery, with prominent citrus like lemon and pineapple. The finish is bone dry with notes of wool.
All of Hill Farmstead beers are great. They live up to the hype and the journey up into the farm hills of VT.

750mL capped bottle, stamped 2015.04.09, shared by Prufrock. Voluminous head, cloudy light yellow color. Aroma is funky, very funky and then some light citrus hoppiness. text:
Aaron gave me this bootle. 
Beer pours lightly hazy, pale yellow, with a big ol white head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is more hop forward than anything, big melon & orange fruity notes. The funkiness in the nose is present but restrained letting hop brightness take center stage. Its got a little horse stable, some doughy bread, and a little lemon.

The flavor is really a nice balance of tartness, bitterness, and bright fruit forward hops. Im actually surprised just how tart this beer is, I mean its far from puckering but it brings a nice lemon-like character that matches well with the bright citrus and passionfruit like hop character. The level of bitterness is really well done here as well, higher than one usually expects from either a citra or brett focused beer... but it works pretty well here. The beer is pretty darn dry and Im awfully surprised the alcohol level is as high as 7% here, there is almost no booziness to it, Id guess it around 5% or lower. 

The palate is pleasantly light and prickly with a fairly long finish. 

Great beer.

Majority of 750 mL bottle, consumed on 8-9-15. Bottle purchased for me by my parents at the brewery on a trip to New England. Bottle labeled 2015 04 22, so I drank it at about 3.5 months old, which isnt ideal for a hoppy beer, but it seemed to hold up quite well. Nice, wheaten, saison aroma. Strong, very pleasant, grassy smell features scents of hay and lemongrass. Pours a hazy straw color with a tornado of bubbles. Moderate amount of long-lasting, uneven, cream-colored head. Looks like yellow Chartreuse (the liqueur) in color, with almost a greenish tint. Nice milkiness in the later pours. Looks fantastic. New Zealand hops unmistakable in the taste. Tropical fruitiness: Mango and citrus, including orange and tangerine. Dry yet juicy. Light tartness; hint of rhubarb. Some seawater. Clean, yeasty taste with a hint of chlorine. Quite dry finish that also includes almost a meatiness. Very nice, refreshing, dry finish and aftertaste. This is good! Long, dry, vegetal, grassy aftertaste. Light to medium body, light for the ABV. Good liveliness. Soft in the palate. This is my first Hill Farmstead beer, and I come away thinking that the hype is justified. Despite drinking this with a few months of age, I find that the hoppiness seems well preserved, and I dont think that I missed out on too much extra hops effect. This is a darn good beer, delicious and sophisticated.
Some nice hops and no spices but the farmhouse style is well done. Very light in color, not hazy though. Nice bite to it. Tap

My Bottom Line:
This airy and refreshing brew showcases citrusy tropical fruit, brettanomyces wilderness and an acidic touch in a most elegant mouthfeel.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam tops the glowing yellow.
-Drinkability is very high, as it usually is for a Hill Farmstead ale.
-The flavor profile is well balanced.
-This is the usual level of excellence for a Hill Farmstead brew.
-This was a great pairing with Chèvre à Ma Manière, a creamy goat cheese.

Overall, hot damn, what a wonderful saison that is everything I expected and more. Absolutely stellar!

Bottled 22 April 2015, so about 3 months old. Been waiting to try a beer from these guys for years. Pale hazy yellow with a bright white head. Complex, elegant, lemon and apples, wood and funky farmhouse aroma. Dry hopping with Citra is there without being overpowering like Citra easily can be. Good level of sourness that just cleans everything up at the end. Ill get to the brewery one day!

Shared 2015 bottle by a friend. Poured a hazy pale yellow colour with a big white head. Lots of citrus and sweet subtle malts hits the nose, with some yeast notice, orange, and sweet tropical fruits, with apricots, and some spiced yeast notice. Spiced hop notice, and some basement funk. Full bodied mouthfeel. Really refreshing and tasty

Location: 750 ml bottle from the brewery, 7/24/15


Aroma: It has an aroma of bright brett funk, has that typical earthy, funky aroma, horse blanket, or whatever. The citrus tones shine through underneath as well, but the brett dominates for me

Appearance: Pours a bright gold color with a large, almost soapy looking head and heavy lacing

Flavor: The taste is funky as well, little more citrus, and some spicy Saison yeast as well

Palate: The body is medium, the carbonation is lively, super drinkable, with a nice dry finish

Overall Impression: 
The brett works really nicely here. It drys it out quite well, as you might expect. It also plays quite well with the citrus/lemon and the yeast/spice undertones. Makes for a really enjoyable overall combination. I liked this version quite a bit. For a beer with this much carbonation it is extremely drinkable. Another excellent one from Hill Farmstead.

bootle thank you macboot! rustic wild flowers, foggy farm air. a bit musty, minerally. soft perfume. fun peach, banana, pear fruit, complimented by a zesty lemon lime zest citrus character. spritzy carbonation. downside: a bit of bitter resiny hops and acidic sulfury cider on the lingering finish could be let outside. but a fun, multi-dimensional bretty hoppy rustic belgium ale. a lot of pieces, but fit together reasonably well. nicely attenuated. with each sipe, you can drink a different bier as you shift focus. peteable.

bottle shared with the missus on her b-day! pours hazy/cloudy pale but glowing golden pour with a creamy white head offering good retention and lacing. bright brettied citrus, on-the-spot light tartness, tons of orchard fruitiness - juicy tropical notes as well, delicate woodsy if not woody foeder staves, bitter herbs, pepper, allspice. average to light carbonation, light body - oily and fluffy as hell; drying bretty herbal-spicy-citrusy finish. excellent!

bottle, april date, thanks rey .. . pours a straw amber .. solid foam, really awesome lacing .. the deaf community .. . mild brett, hay, and bread crust .. medium mouth and a nice relaxing finish .. very nice beer .. . . nice. I just tweezle to the legthrum, then try to gromp a bit.

A hazed golden saison with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with light orange peel and Citra, light and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with loads of Citra hop, orange pulp nice and smooth. On tap at Vermont brewfest 2015.

4/VII/15 - 75cl bottle @ RBBSG IV - BB: n/a, bottled: 22/IV/15 (2015-841)  Thanks to yourilevesque for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy bright yellow beer, creamy irregular off-white to yellow head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: little funky, sourish, lemony, very fruity, artificial brett. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very fruity start, bit yeasty, sweet, artificial brett, sugary. Aftertaste: very fruity, peaches, sweet, citrus, artificial brett again, bit sugary. Another overly hyped saison from HFS...
Bottle from yourilevesque @ RBBSG 2015. Many thanks! Hazy yellow colour, medium carbonation. Crispy mouth feel. Aroma of citrus, brett. Tart and fruity with bitter hoppy aftertaste. Nice!

Draft at farmhouse. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a big fluffy white head. Aromas of floral, straw, and funk. Flavor was spices, funk, floral, and bandage. Medium body with a sticky texture. Lively carbonation and dry finish.

Pours hazy golden yellow with tall white head. Aroma of citrus, elderflower, light bretta, yum! Taste is crisp and citrusy lightly tart funky with a smooth sweet finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

[ 15 Bottle ][ 8oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ - ? ][ Tulip ][ 04.07.15 ]hazy gold, puffy white head, lasts. Soapy concrete nose, lightly floral and peppery, quite hoppy. Too much eggy sulfur in nose, esters very prevalent. Heavy lemon zest in flavor, lightly dusty concrete, stinky with light tang, moderate pale malt through coating, zesty finish, heavy esters dominating throughout in flaked wheat, minor pepper, still attenuated very well.

Bottle at small tasting at home.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, dry. Not the most spectacular Hill Farmstead

Bottle @ Saturday night tasting - The Stein & Vine. Bottled 03/2015.
Dorée-pâle présentant un léger trouble, col blanc.
Arôme est bien fleuri, note de citra, levure et un agréable fuité. Le funk du brett semble être plus discret.
Palais est sec, levure belge, fleuri, fruité et une note de citronné venant du houblonnage.
Bottle, shared at RBAG 2015. Very hazy beight yellow, lemon and celery seed, lightly funky, tart and bright.!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Light sweat on a deep huff, ł citrusy leather, incredibly refrehing, orange, white wine, hints of very watered down pineapple, tropical goodness, acidic funk. This is amazing.

Bottle thanks to Duff for sharing this beauty. Appearance is light yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma is very juicy, with tropical fruit, citrus, and light funk. Taste is citrus, Brett funk, bone dry finish, with some lingering citrus funk. As per usual this is very much on point, I imagine this will age well as the Brett continues to develop, but this is tasting very good at the moment.

Bottle. Pour is hazy gold with a large white head. Aroma and flavor are funky and earthy with dry floral hop notes and the beauty that is HF house yeast. Its grassy with notes of hay and subtle mineral notes. Really good.
Very lemony, with some orange flavour kicking in at room temperature. very satisfying and drinkable. Fresh aromas.
Bottle at RBBSG, thanks for sharing Youri. Some brett, hoppy smell. Taste is quite bitter, little brett, very heavy aftertaste. Nice.

July 4th #52 rate for the weekend. Poured a light cloudy neon yellow with aromas of light wheat with Citra hops, light tropical fruit and some dryness. Flavors are dry tropical fruit with hay some hunk and nice citrus and light hops. Easy drinker for the heat enjoyable this is great stuff.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur dorée translucide, mousse blanche nuageuse et éternelle laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de citron, malt, levure, houblon fruité, floral. Goût de citron, malt, levure, touche dalcool, amertume moyenne. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.

Bottle thanks to thepatrickman. Aroma is strong wheat and black pepper song with some citrus peel and barnyard. Tastes dry and a little bitter. Dont get much citra hop except for maybe some dankness. Its mostly heavy wheat and yeast. Its tasty but on the low end of HF quality.

Bottle, 07/01/2015. Pours a clear golden yellow, big rocky white head with foamy lacing. Aroma is earthy lemon wheat, mild citrus, floral notes, big brett notes in the finish. Taste is wheat, mineral character, grassy lemony hops, herbal bitterness, long dry finish. Soft, light body, good carbonation. Tasty.
Draught via ginger Manhattan slight opaque off gold pour. A bit of a yeasty band aid front blending into lemony citrus. Pretty good.

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy dull golden with a big lively white head. Aroma of weedy and citrus hops, peppery saison yeast, herbal notes and Brett funk. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter and a touch sour. Medium bodied with over moderate carbonation. Nice Brett notes but comes across a bit too herbal, sharp and not so balanced. Good, but have had so much better from HF.

bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis. big thanks.
Thick creamy white head. Cloudy lemony pour. Citrus aroma. Very good
750ml bottle from April 2015. Pours a hazy golden color with s lot of frothy head. Aroma of Belgian yeast. Nice balance of the hops with the yeast fruitiness. Dry and refreshing.

Draft. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Soft fruity notes, some flowery and herbal notes, low sweetness, faint rustic bretty yeast, and a super dry finish. Sharp, clean, clear, and super drinkable. Pretty awesome.

Bottle as the start of a trading three way, LOL. Pours a golden yellow, not hazy but not see through either, massive fluffy white head, lots of suds like lacing. Nose is very saison like, very refreshing, good hop flavour and bitterness, slightly tart. Pretty outstanding. Reminds me of Bastogne yeast for some reason.
Hazy straw pour with white head. Nose was hops, citrus, funky and yeasty. tasted tart, with yeast, funk notes, and that Vermont IPA flavor.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Very hazy. Huge fluffy white head. Great retention. Citra comes through in the nose with doughy malts. Some brett, but not overwhelming. Taste is much more brett dominated. Earthy. Slight doughy sweetness and sweet orange hoppiness. Medium light. Soft carbonation. Brett detracts from the drinkability a little. Not Hill Farmsteads best offering, but well-made as always. I thought the brett would make it more interesting, but it just makes it a little abrasive.

750ml. Thanks to McBoost. Slightly hazy yellow. Citrus hops, pineapple, Dry Brett, hay. Slight barnyard. Some tartness and lemon. Its like session IPA meets Berlinerwiese with a perfect balance of hoppy and tart.

Really nice dry saison. Hoppiness comes through with light bitter, but the yeast is really highlighted here. Goes down way easy with lots of hay and ever so slight fruit notes. Good stuff. A bit more dry funk than the 2014 version I think, but would need to have them side by side to be sure.

bottle, from brewery. dated 4/22/2015. real good aroma, nice citrus scent woth strong brettt streak. hazed yellow gold color, ok head and lace. medium sour flavor, medium body, smmoth mouthfeel, dry sweet tart finish. thats nice. really liked the mix in the aroma, would get hoppy sweet streak wirth strong yeasty breet side.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle at James 10k tasting. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Musk and citrus on the nose, funk, soft yeast. Musky with funk and citrus.

Cloudy gold pour, large white head. Citrus, grapefruit, musty aroma. Funk and Brett take a backseat to citrus hopping, grapefruit, barnyard, fairly funky, yeast, hay, slightly acidic. Everything blends well together with the hopping neither dominating nor taking away from the other characteristics of this beer. Medium body, This was a pleasure to drink.

Bottle 750ml @ Hill Farmstead Brewery, Greensboro, VT
Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, citrus, grape, hint of funk and brett. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long yeasty, citrus and grape finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Hazy yellow pour with a big frothy white head. Citrus lemon forward, hay, grass, bubblegum, leathery old world funkiness with a touch of slate. The hop nose in this is quite bright for a saison but it certainly isnt distracted. Pretty solid, medium bitterness. Sour, medium as well. Tart enough but not over the top in any way. Would love to drink this outside in the hot weather, and I am!
Very cloudy golden, bit white head. Very nice citrusy aroma. Very yeasty, slightly funky, citrusy hops. Really fantastic.
Cloudy gold, bright white head. Lemony funk! Earthy, soft, lightly spicy yeast. Wow.
750 ml thanks to John. Pours a solid yellow. Lemon throughout. Citra hops after. Dry. Very tasty.
Bottle. Opaque yellow pour with a white head. Mild hoppy aromas. Nice lemon and citrus saison notes with just enough grapefruit hop bitterness. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottom of the keg so different experience. On tap at Wassail (the cider bar). Very light bodied but intense flavor. Unfortunately a little flat so couldn't fully evaluate palate. Refreshing and bright though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at parker pie: uhhhh this is really good. Pours hazy orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of brett, Belgian funk, mango, citrus, and hay. Taste is more of the same with the wheat coming through when first sipping. Slight bitterness from the brett and hops. Really, really awesome.

Hazy golden color with a large white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of brett, wheat, citrus, and toasted malts. Taste of citrus, tropical fruits, tart wheat, wild yeast, fruity hops, funky, dry finish.

Bottle shared by dreadnaught33. Thanks Yanik!

Light straw yellow body, hazy. Pure white head. Aromas of sunshine, wheat, lemon. Hop character emerges more in the flavor. Citrus, light tartness. Grass and floral notes. Light to medium body. Delicious -no surprise.

750 ml bottle from Chris - thanks again, Chris! Pours a hazy yellow-gold color with a finger of frothy white head that settles into a lasting uneven film and leaves a sheet of lace. Notes of lemon and lime citrus, florals, doughy malts, grass, perfume, herbs, wheat, bretty funk, and minerals. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a tart, funky, floral mouthfeel. Finishes tart and dry. Another excellent iteration in this series.

(Batch 03 2015) Corps laiteux et jaune avec une tête qui saccroche. Quelques pointes collées ici et là. Son nez vraiment citronné montre des céréales pâles, du blé, des herbes et des fleurs avec une montée un peu encombrante de la levure. Au goût, le mélange de pamplemousse et de citronnelle me fait penser à un bon jus. Beaucoup de levure dans mon verre. La bouche est à limage des bières de cette même famille. Au final, tout est bien acidulé et amer. Merci à L-P B pour le partage.

750 ml. sampled @ Maldegem tasting. Thanks to Mathieu87 & PriorL. Bottled on 03/2015. Hazy bright orange, creamy white head. Nose is hoppy with lightly cheesy hops, light hay but also overly yeasty, bread, dough, thick yeast, faint funk buried behind the yeast, Taste is overly yeasty, bitter cheesy hops, creamy milky body, bread, white pepper bitter, light herbal, white bread, Body & taste overall far too yeasty for me,. Okay for such a yeasty beer, Another Hill Farmstead that I dont quite understand given the high scores,

Bottle - Light hay and grassy notes and lemon and notes. Hazy yellow gold with a decent white head. Sweet, lemon, herbal bitterness and a bit of soapy finish. Nice, but I think I like the older version better.
Pale golden pour. Big head that prevented a full pour. Slow to fall, plenty of lacing. Earthy aroma. Some notes of hops, but not much. Taste is a dry malt with some Brett. Not bad.

750ml bottle. Cloudy yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are wheat, lemon, grapefruit rind, bubblegum, lychee and tropical fruit with grassy and light funky notes. Light sourness, moderate tartness. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, slick texture.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Nose brings out dank dry hops, brett and farmhouse yeast. Flavour is along the same lines, with loads of dry hops and funky brett. Fairly tart, dry hopped and oaky. Complex and well-balanced. Superior to the 2014 rendition. Excellent.

On tap. Somewhat murky golden pour with a nice creamy white head with some lasting power. Lemon, grass, oak, yeast, dry and somewhat mineraly brett, grapefruit, moderate+ carbonation, light+ body, enjoyable and would like to see how this will develop in the bottle over a bit of time.

Bottle @ home, thanks to michcam8 for sending! Pours a cloudy yellow appearance with a bubbly, white head. The aroma is quite herbal, some funk, lemon, freshly cut grass, and vanilla. Maybe a hint of plastic / band-aid. Pillowy mouth feel. Quite herbal flavor. Moderate light bitterness. Low sweetness. Tons of grass, leaves, and herbal notes. Some tropical fruit, mango, papaya, and some citrus. Finishes cleanly. Not a ton in the aftertaste. Easy chugger. Good beer.

Pour out of 750 ml bottle, big thanks to Aaron for the pour! Hazy golden pour with white head, aroma brought lots of bread, dough, lots of yeasty notes into a bit of orange, pine, lemon, slight vanilla, touch of yeasty note, into a bit of grass, mineral notes. Taste was a mix of mineral, grass, bread, some slight earth into a bit of orange, grapefruit, lemon, slight spice, touch of vanilla, grain, touch of yeasty, doughy notes mineral, some oaky notes, finishing more bready, slightly dry. Very tasty.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2016 Bottle at home. Pour is slightly hazy golden with a big white head and sticky lacing. Big bretty aroma - pineapple, mango, papaya - herbal, band-aid, medicinal, some grass, and lemon drops in the aroma. Awesome!! Taste is band-aid, herbal, pineapple, mandarins, grassy, lemon peel, biscuit, and medincinal with a lightly bitter/funky finish. Medium body with crisp carbonation. Very Orval-esque - funky, herbal, yet hoppy and fruity. Exceptional offering. 
 This is the 5th or 6th time I have had this version and it gets better and better every time. Bone dry, great herbal characteristics, somehow retains its hopiness, and lots of tropical fruit. Probably my favorite Hill Farmstead saison.
2015 bottle, Great aroma, your standard bad ass HF beer. Then it goes a little apririny in the finish, will definitely try another bottle in 6 months.

Hill Farmstead, quand tu nous tiens... Bouteille partagée avec mon ami David-Samuel. Cheers man! Blonde presque blanche offrant une mousse de grosses bulles abondantes. Le houblon Citra est responsable dune grande partie de laction qui se déroule à la fois dans mon verre, mon nez et ma bouche! Cette explosion de citron est à ce point intense que lattaque frôle des saveurs et des flaveurs chlorées. Cest sec, le corps est moyen, leffervescence abondante et citronné de manière quasi-affolante. La fin de bouche est particulière: le tout sestompe sèchement et rapidement. La tempête nest quen fait une forte averse. Le calme qui suit est sauvage, et chevalin. Cette bière fantastique est encore une fois, un grand produit dune grande brasserie!

Bottle, shared with Luk. Hazy pale gold pour with rich creamy white head. Aroma is really nice, super floral, light grassiness, very light citrusy notes, light bretty character. Taste is easy going, soft bready cereals, fruity/grassy hop, super quaffable. Palate is med-light bodied with super soft silky carbonation, rather dry. Really good stuff, liked it more than the previous Dorothy which I thought was maybe a tad sweeter, this is so light and refreshing its stunning.

Pours a super hazy but bright yellow with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of tropical fruit juice, hoppy and lightly wild. Taste is juicy too, moderately bitter and lightly tart. Lemony with some light backing cereals. Not really funky. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and of fine bubbles and mouthfeel just juicy. Overall a really nice one, I need more!

25.4 oz bottle. Misty yellow with a snow white cap. Nose is grass, lemon basil, honeysuckle and light mint. Crisp medium body with lingering resin. Taste is eucalyptus, grapefruit, grass and lime peel with their distinctive minerally finish.

Bottle: Murky, turbid, & vibrant golden-yellow with a fluffy, bone-white head that leaves nice lacing behind. Strong Brett aroma; loads of barnyard must, damp cotton blanket, & wet oak toppled with notes of leaves, flowers, grass, hop resin, grapefruit, & citrus zest. A little bit of crackers, too. Flavor amplifies the citrus zest, grapefruit, & tangerine a bit with a nice lemon meringue twang to it. Still maintains a strong floral presence; lots of flowers, grass, & some white pepper spice. Hops are definitely more potent in this vintage of Dorothy than last years. Dry finish, lingering notes of hop resin, grapefruit rind, flowers, & pale malt. Lovely stuff.

Une mousse blanche qui a fière allure se pose sur une bière trouble de couleur dorée. Des notes minérales et poussiéreuses gracieuseté des brettanomynces côtoient des arômes fruités et résineux au nez. Le Citra accomplit sa besogne à merveille en bouche, ses propriétés fruitées étant soutenues par une céréale mordante et un léger aspect funky. Une carbonatation vive et une sécheresse évidente font de cette de bière un vrai plaisir à déguster. Superbe produit de HF, encore et toujours.

Bottle (750 ml). 03-2015 bottling. 

Appearance: Hazy glowing yellow-golden with a medium easy to revive white head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Citrus forward (orange peel, tangerine, lemon) along dusty brettanomyces, mineral notes, subdued but interesting farmhouse charachter and light spiciness. 

Taste: Citrus forward but light bright than in the aroma while the dusty brettanomyces takes more place. Quite mineral as well with light tingling spiciness and moderate bitterness.

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Dry finish. Lingering mineral presence. Dusty and citrusy as well. 

Overall: I wouldnt say its better than the previous version of Dorothy but its certainly different. More in line with their other Saison and while its similar to Wheat is the New Hops (as stated in the description) this one is less bright, heavier and the citrus isnt shining nearly as much. Tasty Saison.

Actually quite dissapointed in this. Drank side by side with 8/14 and 12/14 batches and this was very similar to the 12/14 batch which i also wasnt a huge fan of. The 8/14 batch stood out as far better. This version pours a very pale color with very light carbonation. Lacks that creamy light mouthfeel and fluffy head of most HF saisons. Aroma is nice with bright citrus fruits, mango, pineapple, and pear with a very mild touch of brett. Taste falls way short. No real tartness and some light bitterness. I didnt see what was wrong with the 8/14 batch.
750ml bottle pours a hazy gold with a thick off white head. dry hop grapefruit and a bit of a citrus brett finish

Got to experience this wonderful beer at Prohibition Pig and it was certainly one of my top 3 beers of all time. Amazing floral aroma, kinda funky. Very hoppy with tropical smell and a bitter  back end. Refreshing. Probably a bit better to enjoy when it's warm out.
Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a hazy gold with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong brett, citra, wheat. Slick mouth, juicy, citrus, light funk, oak, really nice.
Bottle. No label taken. Pours hazy golden white head. Nose/taste of citrus, funky wheat, oak and light herbal hop funk. Medium body.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with white head. Citrus, herbal hop aromas. Light citrus, sour, light grassy and hop tones.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 Bottle at clockworks 10k. Pours a beautiful hazy golden with thick white lacing. Aroma is dry hop, funk and wheat. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of sour wheat, funk, dry fruit and fresh hop. Materially better than the 2014 batch. 2015 Batch on draft at Three Penny with Paul. Pours a bright and beautiful golden orange body with thick 3 inch white head. Mouthfeel is juicy and tart with notes of sour oak, bright sour fruit, white wine, funk, lemon, brett and soft earthy wheat. Incredible. +0.2
Very light yellow pour. Very cloudy. Soft white head. Grapefruit and wheat nose. Wheat, hoppy and a nice bitterness in the finish. Refreshing. Clean.

Bottle to glass. Thanks JP! Pours a cloudy light golden yellow color with a decent white foamy head. Aroma is a very pleasant tart, fruity, barnyard funk. Flavor is a light funk, yeast, classic saison character. Lighter in body and very drinkable. Very nice saison.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear yellow pour with a thick white head. Aroma of funk and light citrus. Tart citrus flavor with funky brett before a bitter finish.

March 2015 batch into a wine glass. Pours a hazy amber yellow with long clinging white foam. Nose is clean grass, wheat, pepper and light tropical hops. Taste is wheat, light spices, lemon grass, some juicy hops and light light malt. A faint lingering bitter black pepper element. The hops arent exactly in your face and the brett is very mild and young making for a refreshing easy drinking tropical saison.

Bottle thanks to MacBoost ! Pours a medium golden color with fluffy fingers of foam. Punchy citrus, lemongrass, horsehair, floral fieldgrass and subtle tropical undertones. Palate is zesty with traces of tart citrus peel, barnyard funk and rustic soft malt to round out the backend. Solid bitter citrus pith and grass lingers.
Cloudy straw, fine white foam, clove, mint, grape nuts, lemon, tangerine, rindy. Substantial bitter, lightly creamy. Quite tasty.
So crisp and smooth. Tons of fruits even with none actually added. Dry finish with a lasting enjoyment.

750 bottle purchased from HF. Bottled 03/15. Pours a light cloudy yellow straw color with a large foamy white head. Aroma of Brett yeast, crisp hops, and zesty lemon. Taste of Brett yeast, zesty lemon, and bitter hops. Another gem from HF.

750 ml, bottled 03/15. Pours hazy light lemon yellow color, big fluffy white head. Aroma is lemon, orange, lots of citrus, slight funk, very slight dankness, malt biscuit. Awesome aroma. Flavor is hoppy funk. Definitely a lot of tart saison characteristics, but blended very well with really bitter hops and the balance is just fantastic. I didnt know beforehand, but this tastes exactly like what they use, brettanomyces and citra. finding Lemon, orange, sour notes all come together so well. Nice effervescence on this. One of the best saisons Ive had.

750 ml bottle thanks to Eric S. Aroma has a grass, hay and mild Bretty funk. The flavor has the same flavors with a nice lingering bitterness as well as mild lingering funk. The citrus is also here in abundance. Very nice.
Bottle shared by Dan. Nose is hay like with some barny funk. Light grassiness. Hazy pale yellow. Taste is a light malt sweetness with a touch of citrus. Grassy hop flavor. Solid.
Funky, barnyard, lightly tart, fruity. Golden cloudy white head. Funky, fruity hops, smooth. Refreshing.

Bottle shared by Matt at StateLine... Murky/cloudy orange color... with a small head. Nose of orange peel, earthy/dirt notes, black pepper, saison spices... Taste of light wheat/hay, earthy saison spices, black pepper, lemon, slight hop presence with a nice tartness to it. Body is medium but really easy to drink. Overall great beer as most of Hill farmstead beers are. Thanks to matt for being so generous and sharing! PEPPER!

Bottle picked up this week @ Hill Farmstead. 75CL split 2 ways at 38F in stemmed HF glasses. Im also not sure it should be a new entry but it does have a different taste enough that it could be considered so.

A - Very cloudy, bright yellow 3 finger tight white bubbly head. fades to some sticky lacing. 

S - Orange peels, pepper, lemon, funky wheat and hay. Citra dry hopping totally having a field day in the aroma.

T - Taste is actually very similar to Wheat is the New Hops (2014 batch @ HFS). Chewy, brett funk is minimal but will grow. Brett B? Sweet oranges, sharp bitterness at the finish with a slight acidity.

M - Thick, chewy, nice mouthfeel.

O - Great re-mix on the 2014 Dorothy. Enjoyed quite a bit.

Pour is hazed pale yellow with lots of tight white head. Nose is heavily hopped with a strong leathery brett balance and moderate farmhouse quality. The citra hops do a better job adding balance than in the last variation, much more tropical and the melon rind works well. Flavor is again more hopped or brighter hopped than the last. The citra musk and the brett work well, slightly muted finish and bitterness lingers a bit. Light body, soft carb, fairly dry.
Murky pale yellow, not much head. Smells like steel, vanilla, hay, grass and sea air. Taste fresh flower, pepper, and orange. Nice stuff, pretty refreshing.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of light citrusy and fruity hops, some light Brett funk/tartness, some pale malts, and some light dough/fruit notes. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A solid beer but I think it still has room for improvement.

From a bottle. Pours a beautiful hazy dark yellow, with a fluffy white head. Aroma of lemon zest, citrus, and bread. Taste is citrus, slightly tart, thin body, and brett. Dry finish, taste lingers a little...on the lemon, no detection of alcohol. Great beer!

Bottle from Hill Farmstead. Pours a hazed banana yellow with a puffy white head. Strong brett aromas, coupled with citrus tang. Deep cobwebs mixed with dusty library books and citrus juice. Intense funk. Dry. This beer does multiple reps. No other way to describe it, this beer is the truth.

Bottle. Pours cloudy translucent yellow with voluminous white head. Aroma is somewhat reminiscent of Saison Dupont, but with rustic funk and piney, citrusy hops: spice, banana, and straw are prominent, even a bit of bubblegum, as well as lemon, fresh dough, tangerine, orange peel, white grape, and lychee. Quite complex. Taste is orange and grapefruit rind fading into a spicy, doughy middle with orange, pine, hints of mango, and citrus rind bitterness on the finish. Mouthfeel is a standout, creamy and buoyant with just enough carb. Bitterness could be dialed back slightly. This is very good, though, and Id put it more in the hoppy saison camp than brett pale ale.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 100th Hill Farm rating. Excited to see the 14 version revamped since it was one of my least favorite hill beers of late. Just lacked any Hill Farm qualities and was overly Belgian. This one is dry hopped with a very nice amount of Citra which did wonders to aroma and overall palatability. Nose of citra, tropical bubblegum, yeast, pineapple, and juicy hops. Flavor is most of the same with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Went back for seconds.
Pour from a fresh bottle at the source. Pours straw gold with a white head. Aroma is lemon, floral, mild funk. Flavor is melon, lemon, dry. Finished with grassy bitterness.
